name: Scribd Downloader
tagline: Save Scribd documents instantly for offline reading.
description:
Scribd Downloader gives creators and teams a dependable way to save Scribd documents instantly for offline reading. Instead of juggling manual captures or questionable browser extensions, it pulls content directly from Scribd with consistent quality and predictable results.

It supports Documents and books from Scribd, PDFs, audiobooks, and text documents, and Batch user libraries/collections downloads, so you can move quickly from download to delivery without tedious rework. Use it to archive Scribd assets, prep client deliverables, or keep your library accessible when connectivity is limited.

faqs.question: How do I use the Scribd downloader?
faqs.answer: Install the browser extension, navigate to Scribd, find the content you want to download, and click the download button that appears. The content will be saved to your chosen location.

faqs.question: What quality options are available?
faqs.answer: The downloader supports all available quality levels from Scribd, ranging from standard definition up to 4K or higher where available. You can select your preferred quality before downloading.

faqs.question: Does this work with all Scribd content?
faqs.answer: The downloader works with most publicly accessible content on Scribd. Some restricted or DRM-protected content may not be downloadable.

faqs.question: Will downloads continue if my internet connection drops?
faqs.answer: If your connection is interrupted, you may need to restart the download. However, for most content, downloads complete quickly enough that interruptions are rare.

faqs.question: Is there a download limit?
faqs.answer: There are no artificial download limits imposed by the extension. You can download as much content as your storage space allows, one item at a time.

faqs.question: How do I organize my downloaded content?
faqs.answer: Downloaded files are saved to your selected folder. You can organize them manually using your computer's file system, creating folders by date, topic, or any system that works for you.

faqs.question: Does this work on all browsers?
faqs.answer: The extension works on major desktop browsers including Chrome, Firefox, and Edge. Make sure your browser is up to date for the best compatibility.

faqs.question: Is my data kept private?
faqs.answer: Yes, the extension operates entirely on your local device. No download history or personal data is sent to external servers, ensuring complete privacy.
